qas.question: What term is used to describe the belief that Mary remained a virgin for her entire life?
Which Latin father described the belief that Jesus' siblings were his cousins?
Which churches teach that Jesus' brothers and sister were step-siblings from a previous marriage of Joseph the Betrothed?
What document teaches that Jesus' brothers and sisters were older children of Joseph from a previous marriage?
Which doctrine describes the belief that Mary remained a virgin, even though she gave birth to Jesus?
What is the name of the Latin father who is considered Jesus' cousin?
What doctrine asserts Mary's real and perpetual virginity before the act of giving birth to Jesus?
What is the term used for Mary before giving birth to Jesus?
Who wrote the Protoevangelium of James?

context: <a4_0><b6_0>The Perpetual Virginity of Mary<b6_0/><a4_0/> asserts Mary's real and perpetual virginity even in the act of giving birth to the Son of God made Man. The term <a0_0><b7_0>Ever-Virgin<b7_0/><a0_0/> (Greek ἀειπάρθενος) is applied in this case, stating that Mary remained a virgin for the remainder of her life, making Jesus her biological and only son, whose conception and birth are held to be miraculous. While the <a2_0>Orthodox Churches<a2_0/> hold the position articulated in the <a3_0>Protoevangelium of James<a3_0/> that Jesus' brothers and sisters are older children of <b8_0>Joseph the Betrothed<b8_0/>, step-siblings from an earlier marriage that left him widowed, Roman Catholic teaching follows the Latin father <a1_0><b5_0>Jerome<b5_0/><a1_0/> in considering them Jesus' cousins.
